Item.Review:
This is a great ereader as far as readers go. It uses different formats, has touch screen, is back lit. you can choose the font size that is easy on your eyes. It has a full touch screen that is very responsive with stylus. The screen is easy to read and is 7" . The only problem with this ereader is that you really have to dig for information and tabs. and the battery sometimes has to be taken out and put back in because the tablet freezes up. The pros are that it is a great ereader, price is reasonable, you can watch movies, read books and listen to music and it is browser supported for internet use as well. 4 hour battery charge. The cons are it does freeze up and it takes patience to use it.
Processing Speed
could be more powerful
Weight
easy to hold and trav ... el with.
App Availability
only available apps are on the cruz website
Design
Very sleek and cool looking
Durability
I have dropped it once and it still works great. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent alternative to big name brands
Item.Review:
Pros: Wide range of features for price; easily customizable
Cons: Short battery life
After doing a hours and hours of research, I bought this because it had all of the features I wanted - such as full color screen and storage expandability - at a great price (I got it for under $100 at Best Buy). Being new to android technology, it took me a few hours to figure out - the included manual doesn't provide much "how to" info - but, once I did, it was incredibly easy to use.
As another reviewer said, the manufacturer's android app store leaves a LOT to be desired, but all the apps you could want or need are available for download elsewhere online, usually for free. With the myriad of apps available, you can easily and cheaply customize the ereader to your preferences, which ... I did in a matter of hours.
For instance, Amazon (Kindle) and Barnes & Noble (Nook) both have free apps available for download on their websites to make this compatible with their epublications (you can't simply download their pubs and expect them to work; you need their software). Same thing for other epublication sites and library ebooks. A lot of free compatibility apps - and publications - are available.
The biggest negative about this ereader is the short battery life, thanks to the full color screen. Although I consider this a reasonable trade off for the great price and all the features I got, some people will find the short battery life annoying.
The other primary negative is the reader's physical dimensions. They're different enough from the Nook, Kindle and other big brand readers that finding properly fitting cases/sleeves can be challenging. Yes, it comes with a black neoprene sleeve, but I wanted something more fun and ended up ordering two custom made sleeves from an online craft site. expand » « collapse

Pros: Everything, but moslty the size.
Cons: hard to find cases to fit it.
I have used Palm Pilots, Pocket PC's, iPods, and smartphones, and this tablet ranks up there with the smartphones. I have been using this tablet for about a week, and really love it. It is great for reading books (which is my primary reason for wanting this one) and surfing the web. I researched all the ereaders and felt the Cruz T301 was a better deal. I had some ebooks prior and there was no problem installing them onto the Cruz. It is also great for getting email, listening to music, and watching U-tube video. There have been complaints about the screen being a fingerprint magnet, but honestly you don't even see the fingerprints when it is on. If you are wanting something to read books and/or surf t ... he web, this is it! expand » « collapse

Pros: Price - marginally
Cons: Opening box
Do not waste your time. No apps available - basically app store is a website. Also if you do some digging the processor this device uses has a possibility to go to 2.2, but good luck finding the ROM support for it.
You are better off and play the wait game or in 7" form factor buy the Nook Color - very customizable and has tons of support on XDA for 2.1 thru 2.3.

Pros: color capacitive touch screen for $199, long battery, Kindle
Cons: no Flash, no 3-D games, no 3G option
I upgraded from my Cruz Reader - gave that one to my wife. I didn't get this at BBY but I really love it. Capacitive screen is great, but I really like the 4:3 ratio screen. This thing is not perfect, not an Ipad, but it's more than fast enough on wifi, I love Android, and there is a rumor that Velocity is releasing Android 2.2 in March, which will help some more. Also love that my Kindle books automatically download as soon as I log in to the Kindle app. Heartily recommended for the price. Oh, phenomenal battery life - I am charging it only about 1 time every 4 or 5 days of use.

Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
Just got my Cruz Tablet earlier this week. My wife is thrilled to have this and loves the size as she can carry it around in her purse. I agree with other reviews that the Cruz Marketplace doesn't have many apps at all. But if you are looking for an inexpensive tablet to surf the web and use as an e-read this one works great. I love that it has both the Kindle app and you can install Overdrive which works as a ePUB reader so you can download books for free from your local library.
Item.HelpfulCount: 6 out of 6 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use
Cons: Slow
No, it's definitely not an iPad, but I'm quite happy with this little tablet. It can be slow when accessing the internet, and it has suddenly shut down the browser on me once or twice, but I've read through several books now with little to no trouble, and I love the flexibility the ebooks offer. I can get ebooks from my library with ease, which is really the main reason why I purchased the Cruz rather than a propriety reader, and being able to check email or get online while away from home is a great bonus. As long as you think of this tablet as a reader with benefits, I think you'll be pleased with it.
Item.HelpfulCount: 3 out of 3 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: size and color
Cons: everything since it is DOA
Purchased today as a gift for my wife. DOA right out of the sealed box.
Reviews indicate that NOOK can not be installed and that is the system she prefers. I'll be returning it in the morning.

Pros: Nothing
Cons: Everything
This is the worst product ever. I bought it two hours ago and will be returning it post haste. All I wanted this device to do is allow me to read books. My point is, I wasn't looking for an iPad knock off. I wanted a color reader.
Instead what I got was a head ache. Admittedly, I am a ludite.
There are no directions included, no disc, no instructions. Instead you are left to trying to make the product work with little luck.
So I called tech support. They were little help. They wanted me to use an SD card, save books to that, then put the SD card back into the Cruz. Far too many steps. I am returning this device and getting a Kindle.
I hope the maker of this product is happy with himself for making a product that is ... completely useless and confounding. expand » « collapse

Pros: Good Price. Android 2.2. Faster Browser
Cons: No Android App MArket. Minor Lags. No Adobe flash player
Very Good Tablet/Reader Overall, Before Wen It Had android 2.0 it was laggy and annoying but now with the new android 2.2 upgrade its much more useable, now with better processor and faster web browser. very good tablet/eReader. Love It Overall. Still Has Its Minor Laggs But Way Better Now.

Pros: Battery life, ease of use
Cons: No direct access to the market and the nook app does not work
Not having full access to the real android market stinks, but there are many websites that offer the same apps. The product was easy to upgrade to 2.2 os. Very fun and addictive and great for reading.

Pros: Easy To Use
Cons: Hard wireless connection; Small amount of apps; Freezes; Limited space; Buttons Push hard
Tho i did enjoy this device my excitement did not last for long. My Cruz was perchased threw this staples online site. I found staples very very great [...] But after 2 day after recieveing my device,after exploring and the battery had died, i went to charge it charged it but after charging for a couple hours i went to turn it on and it freezes right at the logo that first pops up. This sounds like a minor glitche so i used the reset button and still did not work. Calling Staples to see if i could use my warrenty staples was very understanding and sent me a new one with a day. The new one worked very well for about a month, I was careful not to download any apps t ... hat could possibly hold viruses but still once again it froze at the same place my previous device had. Tryed everything to reset and get to unfreeze but again no luck. We plan on calling staples and telling them about our purchase and hopefully getting our money back. [...] but unfourtntly this device has proven itself to a BIG Glitche. Do not plan on purchaseing this again. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 7 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: Price, Specs, Uses, Android, Not Apple, WiFi, Tether and more...
Cons: Possibly Addicting
It's an inexpensive Android answer to the iPad in my opinion. It is also my opinion that Android is superior to Apple anyhow. So, consider me at least a bit bias.
I was looking for a great eReader and what I really found was a fun little tablet instead. Games, Apps, Movies, Music, Books, Office Apps, it seems to have it all and then some.
Apple better watch it's back, soon people will realize how over priced their iCrap is and find their way to Android products. This is one that I think is going to lead the way.

Pros: The Screen/resolution and brightness
Cons: The battery life
I have a Kindle DX e-reader and it is to large to take along many places. I purchased the Velocity Cruz with WiFi only, for an e-reader on-the-go. It works so great, that I seldom use my Kindle anymore! When there is low light conditions, this really shines, I just wish the battery was a little bigger.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.ReviewTitle: FINALLY! An outstanding color book reader and more!! Cruz
Item.Review: FINALLY! An outstanding color book reader and more!! Cruz Tablet T301 is amazing. No, it's not an iPad and comparing it to one wouldn't be fair. Look, you wanna spend $499 for an iPad, have at it. However, I got this great tablet for $199.00 from Amazon and I couldn't be happier. It goes WAY beyond a book reader. This little jewel can brings books to life with vibrant color, back lit for great night reading. But can also browse the internet like nobody's business. Check your email, Facebook, eBay and whatever else you have going with the compact easy to carry tablet. Also, this tablet, like many other REQUIRE a data plan. Not so with the Cruz Tablet. You can head out to the local coffee shop, bookstore, or even at home and enjoy effortless internet connections. HOWEVER, this wil ... l not take the place of your home computer or laptop but it a great device is to take with you on the go! expand » « collapse
Very poor quality images. Slow internet connection and unable to access many sites. This experience has convinced me to buy an iPad or something in that catergory.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 4 found this review helpful.

Item.Review: I purchaced the Cuz T 301 tablet on July 24, 2012 and I am very disappointed with the product. There are multiple issues with the tablet. The first is the inability to use Google on the tablet, which after some research shows that it is a persistent issue with this tablet and is unknown as to why but they do offer a work around (Yahoo, MSN, ect.). The second issue is that the tablet is very slow and unresponsive at times.

Item.ReviewTitle: Don't buy this from Tiger Direct
Item.Review: This is advertised as brand new ...it s a reconditioned item. Out of the box, did not work!! I contacted Tiger Direct, and I HAD to contact the manufacturer to get a defective code before they would take this piece of crap back. So very sorry I wasted my valuable time on this...time I can t get back. However, the foreign voice on the phone was very nice to me.

I wanted a color e-reader that would view PDFs and graphs/charts. The Velocity Cruz T301 is a great fit for me. I have the ability to purchase books from Amazon and have them delivered wirelessly to my tablet. It is an easy-to-use reader, and great for making notes to myself or scheduling activities.

We bought this one for my husband and he has been very happy with the tablet itself, but he was having trouble with the cord that charges it. He had to keep playing with it to get it to charge until he finally gave up and we had to send it back to the company to have it replaced. We had only had it less than 6 months. the tablet itself he has no regrets.
Battery Life
The battery last as long as you would expect and as long as the cord will plug in.
Processing Speed
do not have to wait to long
Weight
very light and not hard to hold onto
App Availability
we have found alot of apps
Design
very good
Durability
holds up well

Pros: Good battery life, good price, easy set-up
Cons: Stuck between e-reader and tablet
Purchased this as a gift for someone who wanted a reader after they had been disappointed with the Nook.
Personally I thought it was really good for the price...lots of extras not needed for strictly reading and very customizable thanks to the droid OS.
That being said...it has very little system memory and the processor is not that great so if you are actually in the market for a multi-tasking tablet-LOOK ELSEWHERE. On top of this, in the end, the item was returned. Everything worked great for about four weeks and then the screen just went black and would never come back on-I haven't looked to see if others had this problem so I am just chalking it up to one bad unit. ... r>Traded it for a Kindle. expand » « collapse

Pros: price and flexability
Cons: not sure yet
Great for someone who is new to tablets and readers we just wanted something to browse internet and a few other simple things great price too. plus my 6 year old likes it. works like a phone

Pros: It's in black.
Cons: everything else.
Was unable to download books from kindle web sight. Touch screen was not very responsive had to click several times on screen to get it to respond. Was only able to turn it on once, after that it went dead. Can't get it to turn on anymore. Only had it for less than one hour.

I am really enjoying my Cruz Tab. I mostly use it for an e-reader but, I can use it to go online. I do not have an actual service provider for internet and can use the freebee internet access. It does not get the fastest download capability but I bet with an actual service that you pay for it probably would download faster. The touch screen it awesome. I love this product.

Pros: It's cheap
Cons: Touch screen, Android market's lack of apps, lack of user-friendlyness, weight
I bought this as my first tablet because there were positive reviews and it was within my price range. The set up was annoying because it had the instructions on how to set it up loaded in a folder on the device, I'm fairly tech savvy and it took me a while to figure out. It did not take long to figure out why the price was low, the screen froze a lot, the touch screen, even after calibrating it numerous times, did not respond, the Android market is a joke there were maybe 20 apps I could download, it was very difficult to download books since every time I tried to scroll down the page it would load a book I didn't click on, and it was slow it at everything. If you are lookin ... g for a frustrating waste of $200 this is the tablet for you, if not save up your money and invest in a tablet that actually works and offers more than a hand full of boring apps. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Kindle App doesn't work 100% with T301
Item.Review:
Cons: Lacks Power; Slow
I bought this item to use primarily as an E-reader for my graduate classes. Much to my dismay, Cruz has installed some type of OS that runs on top of the Android OS which prevents the Kindle App from working as it was intended to on the Cruz tablets. Additionally, the App market is very limited, and you are not able to run many of the apps that you may be able to get from other places. Finally, this tablet doesn't allow you to view all websites.
Bottom line, this tablet is great for watching movies and listening to music, but that's why I have an Ipod. Cruz needs to provide a firmware update that will make this product function as it is advertised.
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 3 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: size
Cons: speed
I got this because it was cheap but i have to say it is way more fun than i thought it would be i can easily say that i had some of the best times on this item. Its not fast fast but it does the job and the things it does do at the limited speed are pretty cool. I also have to say i did mod my out with a custom rom and made it run like the wind. But its just a well build machine. And the price for what you get isn't bad i kow a IPAD is way up there but this is like 1/3 of the price and you still get all the goodies so it a big plus in my book.

I just purchased this Micro Cruz Tablet. I have to say that I'm pretty impressed! If you have a wi-fi connection, you can browse the web, check your email, update your facebook, or do whatever it is you do online! This Tablet runs the Android operating system. It has the Borders/Kobo and the Kindle applications available where you can buy books or download free ones! It is color as well, which is fun.
I was disappointed by some of the games available. The Android system gives you a variety of games you can download, however some of apps popular for the Android based phones do not work on the Cruz (such as Angry Birds) and will not let you download, even though you can try.
Overall, I am very pleased with the quality of this Tablet for the money. You can watch movies, r ... ead books, and go on the internet easily without having to lug around a large laptop or netbook. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a Tablet. It is easy for beginners to get the hang of (I have only had mine for 2 weeks), and fun to play with! expand » « collapse

Cons: Not many apps; Bad documentation; Old release of andriod
This product just is not ready for market. They don't let you use the Andoid marketplace - instead you have to use the Cruz marketplace which is very limited. Wait for 6 months for Driod tablets to mature and you will have much better options.

Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Easy To Set Up
this is a great product for the money. Touchscreen very responsive. Clarity very good. Would like more apps from Cruz Market.
I am very pleased with my tablet. it was a great buy for the price .

Pros: Good picture quality
Cons: Slow
Cruz is a little slow. I purchased it as an ereader only. Will do well for that.
small enough to lug around on trips vs laptop a bit on the large size for a 7'' too much glass on face of tablet

Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
It would be better if the OS was upgraded to a 2.1 version and had flash capability

Ipad although much more expensive is much easier to use, has many more features
